intro: Argyrochosma formosa, commonly known as the whiteleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically succulent and covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. Argyrochosma formosa is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
